a.h2: Highlighting Current Page on Navigation Bar Using JavaScript

section.p: In the Navigation bar, the students have added an enhancement to highlight the current page on the menu.

This enhancement goes beyond the basic requirements of the assignment and it is something extra. However, it does contribute to better usability and user experience because the web user can easily identify what page they are on, by just glancing at the navigation menu.
In order for this feature to be implemented:

ol.li: In the .js file, the object document.location obtains the current page URL and stores it into a variable hrefString.
Then, the URL is split to be stored into an array.
The .js code goes through the links in the navigation menu gets gets each link and compares it with the current page URL.
If the links match, then JavaScript would apply a class 'current' from .css to the link.

In the .css file, all elements assigned to this class ‘current’ are set with properties that would make the button on the menu look like it is being highlighted (most notably, setting a different background-color compared to the color of the navigation bar.
